name: Handling and Releasing Fish Safely
description: A gentle guide to holding fish safely, removing hooks cleanly, and returning them to the water with respect.
steps: Wet your hands before touching the fish to preserve protective slime.
Grip firmly but gently — support the belly and avoid squeezing the gills.
Use pliers to remove the hook — if deep, cut line close and release.
Lower the fish into the water — let it regain strength before letting go.
Reflect on the catch with gratitude — even if released.
commonMistakes: Holding fish by the gills or jaw without support.
Letting fish flop on dry ground or boat deck.
Releasing too quickly before fish has recovered.
journalPrompt: When have you rushed past a goodbye? What if parting could be gentle, not hurried?
tairoGuidance: How you release is as sacred as how you caught. Every goodbye is also a memory.
whisper: Every fish you return becomes a teacher for the next.
